content: Thank you for your excellent article and the link to HBR article. For me, limiting time on social networks was what contributed the most to reading more books. I used to be an avid reader but a couple years back I noticed I’m not reading nearly as much as I used to. I decided to reduce the Reddit groups, limit my time on Twitter and to outright quit Facebook. Now, not only do I have more time for reading but I started my photography hobby again. It’s a bit depressing to see how much time social networks take up.
